question: 平日
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>flat</kanji> <kanji>day</kanji>s are boring. They're the same. One day after another. That's definitely not your exciting weekends... that's your boring, flat <vocabulary>weekdays</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>日</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

<vocabulary>Weekdays</vocabulary> are flat, but you do at least earn two entire bales of <reading>hay</reading>. <reading>Gee, two</reading> (<ja>へいじつ</ja>) of them! What a hard worker you are.
